dialogues.text: No, don’t apologize -- I probably do have a “doufi” orientation. But behind “coolness” isn’t there a certain repressing, squashing down or at lack of cultivation of one’s humanity?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Oh, so you think cool people have less humanity?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: No, of course not, I don’t think cool people are entirely inhuman -- just enough to be cool.  121 119.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: In our society there’s all this propaganda in favor of uniqueness, eccentricity, etc, but does the world really want or need more of such traits? Aren’t such people usually terrible pains in the neck? What the world needs to work properly is a large mass of normal people -- I'd like to be one of those -- sorry.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: But you will still do the part?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Of course.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: Dress Rehearsal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the long dance mirror first Lily then Violet appear, i their extravagant costumes for the musical.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Omigod we look ridiculous. Violet looks at their reflection, serene.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Yes. I think that’s good. They disappear from frame. Cut to Freak cueing the music the Suicide Center stereo system. The first notes of the “Damsels” overture begin. VIOLET (CONT’D) So do you know every number from every Fred Astaire movie?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: No, there were two in our school musical. I know those.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: But did performing those two numbers help you overcome adolescent feelings of discouragement and despair?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Absolutely.  122 120.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: (calls) Freak! Freak responds to her signal, pressing “play” on the ster boombox. The song starts -- Fred begins the quiet lyric:

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: If I should suddenly start to sing, Or stand on my head or anything, Don't think that I've lost my senses, It's just that my happiness finally commences. Fred takes Violet’s hand and leads her out of the buildin FRED (CONT’D) The long, long ages of dull despair Are turning into thin air And it seems that suddenly I've Become the happiest guy alive--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred and Violet emerge from the drab building into the mo glorious world of a Seven Oaks version movie musical -- Violet joins him in song.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Things are looking up I've been looking the landscape over And it's covered with 4 leaf clover Oh things are looking up Since love looked up at me! Bitter was my cup But no more will I be the mourner For I've certainly turned the corner Oh things are looking up Since love looked up at me Others from the cast move in behind them, with some pairi off -- Lily with Xavier, Thor with Heather, Frank and Fre with Rose, Jimbo with Priss:

dialogues.speaker: ENSEMBLE
dialogues.text: See the sunbeams Every one beams Just because of you Love's in session And my depression Is unmistakably through They pass Doar Dorm, now a paradise of decorous Dior-ness  123 121.

dialogues.speaker: DOAR DORM CHORUS
dialogues.text: Things are looking up It's a great little world we live in Oh we're happy as pups Since love looked up at us. The song continues, then as the music fades an “iris” fad out of the image -- then partially re-opens: CLOSE UP of a smiling Violet -- lighting, location and costume are dark and atmospheric. The music to a future h dance song starts:

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: (a big smile) Hey, everybody! Let’s--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music goes full blast, the iris opens fully: Violet i a dance locale, perhaps the Lone Star with better lightin

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: do the -- “Sam-bo-la!” To the dance hit’s irresistible beat, Violet does the “Sambola” -- soon joined by the others, except Rose -- th camera moves among the dancers a la “American Bandstand.” Rose sits, watching critically. Jimbo goes to her.

dialogues.speaker: JIMBO
dialogues.text: You’re not dancing? Rose shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Looks to me like just another... Devil Dance. I’m waiting for a dance of truth, and beauty, and righteousness. A dance that glorifies, not the body, but the Lord.

dialogues.speaker: JIMBO
dialogues.text: Wow. You might have a long wait... Credits roll: Subsequently Freak’s partner tires -- he invites Rose to dance; she drops her resistance and joins with great skill.
